channel.title: Make_error_code on Boost.Outcome documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Make_error_code on Boost.Outcome documentation

item.title: Custom payloads
item.description: So far in this tutorial, type EC in result<T, EC> has always been a std::error_code (though it can be of any type you wish instead). EC needs in fact to merely satisfy trait::has_error_code_v<EC> for EC to be treated as if an std::error_code. In turn, trait::has_error_code_v<EC> is true if there exists some ADL discovered free function: make_error_code(EC) returning a std::error_code. make_error_code(get<0>(EC)) returning a std::error_code (i.e. EC might be pair<std::error_code, U> or tuple<std::error_code, .
